name: A Lunar Odyssey
description: This is the moon mission! You have to build a rocket, make it to the moon, and survive long enough to claim the quest reward. Actually getting back to the planet is optional, but recommended. You should look at the starting quests and figure out how to complete them ASAP. It will require generating lots of compressed metals in a metal compressing machine. You want to get moving on them ASAP.

quests.name: To The Moon!
quests.description: Let's go to the moon! Assume you have fueled up the rocket, and have your parachute, and the rocket is on a pad, AND you have oxygen, then let's go for it! Right-click on that rocket, and hit the space bar. If it complains about something, STRONGLY CONSIDER PAYING ATTENTION. You can override by hitting space bar again. It will start a 20-second countdown, and you will launch. In the destination screen, double-click on the overworld, then select the moon. You then click the launch button and it will take you there. It will then deploy the lunar lander. You will want to hold down the space bar so you don't smack into the moon!

tasks.longDescription: Well, before lifting off, I heavily recommend bringing along an energy cell and your fuel loader. You will have to fuel the ship for the return trip when you're on the moon itself!

quests.name: Rocket Man
quests.description: Well here it is . . . the rocket. Stop by here after you build it to get some prizes!

tasks.longDescription: You can see the recipe for it if you search for "tier 1" in the bottom search bar from the inventory screen. You are going to need to compress a lot of metal!

quests.name: Rocket Manufacturing
quests.description: You will have to build a NASA workbench to build the rocket. It comes with plans for the first-tier rocket that you need to get to the moon.

quests.name: Give Me Some Air Here!
quests.description: Ummm, there isn't much air on the moon. Did you think about that? You are going to need an oxygen mask. You might notice a slot for that near your armor and everything in your inventory. You are also going to need some oxygen tanks. For the short duration of your mission, lights tanks will do.

tasks.longDescription: Note: To make the oxygen cannister, you'll need cactus green die. You don't actually need to find a cactus. You can blend yellow and blue dies. You can get these from dandelions and bluebells.

quests.name: Rolling Sheet Metal
quests.description: You are going to need sheet metal for various components on the way to this moon mission. You will have to start with the press, and then start rolling the sheets.

tasks.longDescription: The compressor is powered by coal/charcoal. You will have to feed it some to run it. Run some steel through it to get a sheet. Then start running lots of bronze, aluminum, iron, tin, and more steel through it. You need lots of this stuff. Build another compressor! Then build two more!

quests.name: Getting Back Safely
quests.description: You did plan to get back from the moon, right? You're going to need a parachute!

quests.name: Wafer Madness!
quests.description: To get started on the trip to the moon, you are going to have to make some silicon wafers. The ones for the moon mission require a circuit fabricator. You will also need silicon ore from the deeper recesses. They can be hard to find; the ore looks like coal, but it's a different shade of gray.

tasks.longDescription: I should mention that the fabricator can only be powered from its left side. Galacticraft machines are really fond of this for some bizarre reason.

quests.name: Fueling The Rocket
quests.description: How did you plan to get to the moon without any fuel? Run some oil through this refinery to make fuel. You'll have to then pump it into the rocket right on the pad. You know, I thought rockets ran on hydrogen and oxygen mixes, but apparently in Galcticraft, they run off of petroleum products.

tasks.longDescription: Note: The refinery has to be placed UNDER a source of power. Don't look at me like that. I didn't do it. Also, you want to bring the fuel loader with you to the moon with an energy cell. You need that to refuel the rocket in the lander for getting back!

quests.name: Launchpad
quests.description: The rocket can't launch on any old thing. You have to set up a launch platform. Make nine of these things and set them up for a 3x3 square on the ground. Ummm... do that somewhere where you have a clear view of the sky.
